G.T.6219
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 7th NOVEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
Additional progress by the 4th, 3rd and 1st Armies has? been reported, and the latest line runs as follows:- CARTIGNIES? - DOMPIERRE - MONCEAU-ST-WAAST (all inclusive) then along AVESNES-BAVAI? road as far as the railway South of BAVAI. (Opposite HARGNIES we are East of this road). Along the railway and HONNELLE River to East of ANGRE - West of AUDRIGNIES -? South of QUIEVRAIN and CRESPIN to the SCHELDT at FRESNES.
The total number of prisoners taken since the commencement of the Battle on the 4th inst. is approximately 12,000 and considerably over 200 guns.
French Front.
Considerable advances have been made along the whole of the French front from North of the OISE to the AISNE.
The general line reached from North to South is as follows:- FONTENELLE - E. edge of the FOREST of NOUVION - E. of AUTREPPES - E. of FONTAINE - VERVINS - HARY - RENNEVAL - ROZOY-SUR?ERRE - CHAUMONT-PORCIEN - CORNY - SORCY - ECORDAL - BOUVELLEMONT - N. of VENDRESSE. From there the 1st American Army has advanced to the general line S. of CHEHERY - HARAUCOURT (inclusive) - S. of MOUZON. E. of the MEUSE its gains have been increased and it now holds the line from opposite LI0N-DEVANT-DUN and VILOSNES-SUR-MEUSE.
2. OTHER FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
7th November, 1918.
Issued at 1240.
